title: Simultaneous changes in AD and AS

content.question: Assume that stock prices and home values have increased, raising household wealth. At the same time, productivity increased due to new technology. What is the likely short-run impact on the economy?

choices.label: The aggregate demand <math alttext="open parenthesis, A D, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>(AD)</mtext></mrow></math> curve shifts right and the short-run aggregate supply <math alttext="open parenthesis, S R A S, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>(SRAS)</mtext></mrow></math> curve shifts left, resulting in a higher price level and no change in the real output level.

The aggregate demand <math alttext="open parenthesis, A D, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>(AD)</mtext></mrow></math> curve shifts left and the short-run aggregate supply <math alttext="open parenthesis, S R A S, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>(SRAS)</mtext></mrow></math> curve shifts right, resulting in a lower price level and no change in the real output level.

The aggregate demand <math alttext="open parenthesis, A D, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>(AD)</mtext></mrow></math> curve shifts right and the short-run aggregate supply <math alttext="open parenthesis, S R A S, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>(SRAS)</mtext></mrow></math> curve shifts left, resulting in a higher real output level and lower price level.

Both the aggregate demand <math alttext="open parenthesis, A D, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>(AD)</mtext></mrow></math> and the short-run aggregate supply <math alttext="open parenthesis, S R A S, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>(SRAS)</mtext></mrow></math> curves shift right, resulting in a higher real output level and indeterminate price level.

Both the aggregate demand <math alttext="open parenthesis, A D, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>(AD)</mtext></mrow></math> and the short-run aggregate supply <math alttext="open parenthesis, S R A S, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>(SRAS)</mtext></mrow></math> curves shift right, resulting in a lower real output level and indeterminate price level.

content.answer: Both the aggregate demand <math alttext="open parenthesis, A D, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>(AD)</mtext></mrow></math> and the short-run aggregate supply <math alttext="open parenthesis, S R A S, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>(SRAS)</mtext></mrow></math> curves shift right, resulting in a higher real output level and indeterminate price level.

topic.text: 3.6: Changes in the AD-AS Model in the Short Run

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Determine the outcome of an economic situation using economic concepts, principles, or models.
